sections.name: Warsworn
sections.html:
A warsworn is an animate mass of corpses composed of dozens, sometimes even hundreds, of victims of battle. They are formed by deities of undeath or war or, rarely, spontaneously manifest from the devastation of an especially horrendous battle.

Recall Knowledge - Undead (Religion): DC 37

sections.name: Warsworn
sections.html: While uniquely terrible, war is not the only tragedy that can lead to mass deaths. Other forms of mass undead, similar to warsworn, can sometimes arise from causes such as famine or disaster. Flamesworn rise from large crowds killed by fire, while plagueborn rise when entire townships or even cities perish to disease.

traits.name: Uncommon
traits.text: Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Gargantuan
traits.text: *Space:* 20 feet or more, *Reach (Tall):* 20 feet, *Reach (Long):* 15 feet

traits.name: Undead
traits.text: Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don’t benefit from healing effects.

modifiers.name: +1 status to all saves vs. positive

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item or a creature with a strong alignment.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature’s emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Fear
traits.text: Fear effects evoke the emotion of fear. Effects with this trait always have the mental and emotion traits as well.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

damage.effect: four of the weapon’s damage dice +9 of the weapon’s damage type

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than that listed in the Damage entry. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon that is versatile S can be used to deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you make an attack.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than that listed in the Damage entry. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon that is versatile S can be used to deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you make an attack.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.

ability.name: Absorb

traits.name: Death
traits.text: An effect with the death trait kills you immediately if it reduces you to 0 HP. Some death effects can bring you closer to death or slay you outright without reducing you to 0 HP.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

ability.trigger: The warsworn moves into a dying creature’s space.
ability.effect: The warsworn absorbs the dying creature into itself, instantly killing the creature and healing the warsworn for a number of Hit Points equal to the creature’s level. As long as the warsworn still exists, absorbed creatures can’t be resurrected except by wish or a similarly powerful effect.

ability.name: Animated Weapons

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Evocation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the evocation school of magic, typically involving energy and elemental forces.

ability.text: The warsworn assumes control of unattended weapons within 100 feet, forcing them to levitate around it. The warsworn can telekinetically wield these weapons to make melee Strikes with a reach of 100 feet.

ability.name: Energy Drain

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

ability.text: When a warsworn hits with a corpse wave Strike or damages a creature with Trample, the target must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or become drained 2 and doomed 1. On a critical success, the target becomes temporarily immune to the warsworn’s energy drain for 24 hours.

ability.name: Plummet
ability.text: A creature hit by a warsworn’s scrap ball Strike must attempt a DC 37 Reflex save. On a failure, the target falls prone; if the target was airborne, it falls up to 120 feet, taking damage from the fall and landing prone if the descent brings it to the ground. On a critical failure, the target is also held under a pile of scrap (DC 37 to Escape).

ability.name: Trample
ability.text: Huge or smaller, corpse wave, DC 37
